hints.content:
Every coin has a different value.

Coin name | Picture | Value
- | - | -
Penny | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/d0799f515398b1f48cb0baa7bdc8d0c12e26c70c.png) | $1¢$
Nickel | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/f6c7ae82228012be92b624995809aeabc8e95370.png) | $5¢$
Dime | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/2017369b968caa0c88d046bddf2406665c8cd34d.png) | $10¢$
Quarter | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/1cc5cb6f4c779c49984f5a63a58443ce0ca96ff9.png) | $25¢$

First, let's find how much money Olga had in her purse.

$\underbrace{\purpleD{10¢}}_{\purpleD{1}{\text{ dime}}} +  \underbrace{\goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢}}_{\goldE{2}{\text{ nickels}}} + \underbrace{\maroonD{1¢} + \maroonD{1¢}+ \maroonD{1¢}}_{\maroonD{3}{\text{ pennies}}} = 23¢$

Olga had $23¢$ in her purse.

Now, let's add the amount of money Olga's Oma gave her.

![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/1dce86373c56d73ff518c634ffe484e77dcbdbc6.png)

$\underbrace{23¢}_{{\text{Olga's purse}}} +\underbrace{\blueE{25¢} + \blueE{25¢}}_{\blueE{2}{\text{ quarters}}} + \underbrace{\goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢}}_{\goldE{3}{\text{ nickels}}} +  \underbrace{\maroonD{1¢} + \maroonD{1¢}+ \maroonD{1¢} + \maroonD{1¢}}_{\maroonD{4}{\text{ pennies}}} = 92¢$

Olga had $92¢$ between her purse and the money her Oma gave her.

question.content:
Olga has $1$ dime, $2$ nickels, and $3$ pennies in her purse.

Her Oma gave her the following coins from her purse:

![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/1dce86373c56d73ff518c634ffe484e77dcbdbc6.png)

**How much money does Olga have in all? **  

[[☃ radio 1]]
